ygData.msgSnippet: Quick note, I have climbed up on barns in the Karanas to avoid Grizzly s etc. and not been hit.  Even meditated and cast a few more spells to finish it off. To
ygData.messageBody:
Quick note, I have climbed up on barns in the Karanas to avoid Grizzly's
etc. and not been hit. Even meditated and cast a few more spells to finish
it off.

To stay on research what is the tome you need to actually combine the items
together? Is it the lexicon? Thanks!

-- Elidain Wizard 16th Veeshan

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ken Lee [mailto:kenlee@...]
> Sent: Thursday, May 20, 1999 11:59 AM
> To: EQ_spell_research@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [EQ_spell_research] Levitate as an exploit...
>
>
> From: "Ken Lee" <kenlee@...>
>
> >I've often wondered about such situations when using a levitate
> type spell.
> I'm not high enough level to use them as yet, but would this
> tactic be seen
> as an exploit by Verant?
>
> No, they wouldn't because contrary to what someone else posted, once you
> float down ( and it's a pretty rapid descent ), they can hit you. Height
> makes no difference to mobs. Here's a first hand example. I was playing my
> troll and between the entrance to GUK and South Ro there's a small tower.
> Inside the tower there's a ladder that leads up to the battlements. Now, a
> zombie on the TOP of the tower, was hitting me standing at the
> BOTTOM of the
> tower in the entranceway. Seems to me this is about as unfair as
> being able
> to walk through walls and take swipes at players sitting there medding
> peacefully. : ) However, I can see the need for this.
>
> The other reason Verant couldn't claim that a ' Fly n' Fry ' tactic was an
> expoit would be because it's effectively the same as a root
> spell. They both
> have durations. They both can wear off, so it's not a guaranteed thing. Of
> course, this is all my opinion but I don't see it any other way.
>
> Zalbar
> 18th Wizard
> Solusek Ro
